element.name: EnsureOrder
element.short: If A is greater than B then both numbers are exchanged to make sure that A is never greater than B.

element.name: ExpandRange
element.short: Expands the interval between ALo and AHi by subtracting the fraction ACoeff of the distance AHi-ALo from ALo and adding it to AHi

element.name: SafeEqual
element.short: Checks whether A is equal to B in a way which does not crash when one of the arguments is NaN ("not a number").

element.name: SafeMin
element.short: Returns the minimum of the numbers A and B. Does not crash when one of the values is NaN (Not a Number).

element.name: SafeInRange
element.short: Returns true when AValue is within or at the bounds of the interval between ABound1 and ABound2. The result is correct even if the bounds are in reverse order.

element.name: SafeInRangeWithBounds
element.short: Returns true when AValue is within or at the bounds of the interval between ABound1 and ABound2
element.descr: Whether AValue is at the bounds of the interval is allowed within the specified tolerance AEpsilon where the default AEpsilon=0 is interpreted as a 1E-12 fraction of the interval length.

element.name: SafeNan
element.short: Returns a value of NaN ("not a number") with range checking and overflow checking turned off.

element.name: Ulps
element.short: Converts the double-precision value AX to an integer 2's complement representation.
element.descr: The difference between resulting integers can be interpreted as distance in ulps.

element.name: SafeInfinity
element.short: Returns a value of the special number Infinity with range checking and overflow checking turned off.

element.name: InRangeUlps
element.short: Returns true when AX is within or at the bounds of the interval between ALo and AHi
element.descr: The double-precision parameters are converted to an integer 2's complement representation. The comparison is made with a tolerance of AMaxUlps.

element.name: CumulNormDistr
element.short: Calculates the value of the cumulative normal distribution for the argument AX

element.name: InvCumulNormDistr
element.short: Calculates the value of the inverse cumulative normal distribution for the argument AX
